```{r components, include=FALSE}
slides_from_images <- function(
  path,
  regexp = NULL,
  class = "hide-count",
  background_size = "contain",
  background_position = "top left"
) {
  if (isTRUE(getOption("slide_image_placeholder", FALSE))) {
    return(glue::glue("Slides to be generated from [{path}]({path})"))
  }
  if (fs::is_dir(path)) {
    imgs <- fs::dir_ls(path, regexp = regexp, type = "file", recurse = FALSE)
  } else if (all(fs::is_file(path) && fs::file_exists(path))) {
    imgs <- path
  } else {
    stop("path must be a directory or a vector of images")
  }
  imgs <- fs::path_rel(imgs, ".")
  breaks <- rep("\n---\n", length(imgs))
  breaks[length(breaks)] <- ""

  txt <- glue::glue("
  class: {class}
  background-image: url('{imgs}')
  background-size: {background_size}
  background-position: {background_position}
  {breaks}
  ")

  paste(txt, sep = "", collapse = "")
}
options("slide_image_placeholder" = FALSE)
```

### Case Study 2:  Skill Analytics

* A **Skill Taxonomy** is an organized hierarchy of skills/capabilities.  For example, Python and R might be skills that map to a higher category of *Data Science Programming*.  Managed taxonomies like **[Lightcast Open Skills](https://lightcast.io/open-skills)** provide a good ground truth for understanding a 'structured universe of skills', but not all apply in every organization.

* A **Skill Ontology** is a network of related skills developed by mining your own organizations data.  It provides a foundation for understanding how skills relate to each other in your organization, and is a foundation for skills analytics.

### Example problems this helps solve

* Match **applicants to jobs** based on skill similarity
* Perform **external search** based on skill similarity
* Route unsuccessful applicants to **similar jobs**
* Describe **top skills** in an organizational unit/group
* Infer **underrepresented skills** in an organization unit/group
* Infuse **skill needs** into a location strategy
* Relate **diversity goals** to **skill goals**
* Track **changes in skill profiles** over time
* Much much more...
